DataElement.preferredName: Chemotherapy Or Immunotherapy Therapeutic Procedure Administration Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A coded response to questions which are necessary to allow a person to participate in a clinical study that are related to chemotherapy or immunotherapy as outlined in the protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Chemotherapy And/Or Immunotherapy Therapeutic Procedure Administration Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases._Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid._Therapy designed to induce changes in a patient's immune status in order to treat disease._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process._The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.  Although this term may be used to describe any therapy involving the use of chemical-based agents, it is most commonly used to refer to the variety of chemical-based agents employed to treat cancer.  Cancer chemotherapy works by arresting or killing the growth and spread of cancer cells.  Because cancer cells usually divide much faster than normal cells, they are often very sensitive to the inhibitory actions of chemotherapeutic agents.  Chemotherapy may also include agents that enhance immune function or alter hormonal activity. (NCI04):Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options:(IM-yoo-no-THER-a-pee) Treatment to stimulate or restore the ability of the immune system to fight infections and other diseases. Also used to lessen side effects that may be caused by some cancer treatments.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Did patient receive chemother
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient receive chemotherapy or immunotherapy with checkpoint inhibitor within 4 weeks prior to treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received immunotherapy or immunosuppressive drugs (e.g. chemotherapy or systemic corticosteroids) EXCEPT as noted in section 3.2.10 of the protocol?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has extensive stage disease, have they received chemo-immunotherapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received immunotherapy or immunosuppressive drugs (e.g., chemotherapy or systemic corticosteroids) EXCEPT as noted in section 3.2.10 of the protocol at the time of study treatment initiation?
